course.title: Decision Support Systems
course.catalogDescription: This course uses statistics to help solve business problems, examines case examples of statistical analysis in areas such as marketing, finance and management, and teaches descriptive and inferential techniques using a statistical computer software application - Excel. Topics to be covered include Creating Charts, Working with Charts, Using List Features and Templates, Working with Advanced Functions, Analyzing Data, Using PivotTables, and Working with Data Analysis Tools.

objectives.objective: Apply advanced techniques of spreadsheet software to the task of data analysis.
Gather data from public sources and transform raw datasets to prepare them for analysis.
Categorize the attributes of data objects and analyze the properties of datasets.
Explain the differences among the three main styles of learning: supervised, reinforcement, and unsupervised.
Determine which of the three learning styles is appropriate to a particular problem domain.
Identify examples of classification tasks, including the available input features and output to be predicted.
Describe over-fitting in the context of a problem.
Apply a simple statistical learning algorithm to a classification task and measure the classifier's effectiveness.
Evaluate the performance of a simple learning system on a real-world dataset.
Use statistical software packages to apply machine learning algorithms.
Apply good ethical judgment to data driven decision making.

outline.topic: Data wrangling Gathering data Categorizing attributes of data objects Basic descriptive analytics Visualizing datasets Preprocessing raw datasets
Advanced spreadsheet techniques Complex formulas Conditional formatting Creating charts Pivot tables Macros Using the solver
Review of basic probability and introduction to Bayes Theorem
Supervised learning Well-posed learning problems Classification Regression Evaluating supervised learning models
Ethical issues in data collection and analytics
